workflow.name: AI guest post generator with OpenAI & Google Sheets automation
workflow.description:
‚ú® About this Template

This n8n template automates the process of writing SEO guest post content using OpenAI, based on rules and topics provided in a Google Sheet. The generated articles are saved into a separate sheet for outreach or publishing.

Use cases include:

SEO guest post generation

Content marketing automation for agencies

Outreach planning and editorial automation

üí° Good to Know

OpenAI API usage costs apply based on the selected model (e.g., GPT-4).

This automation uses Google Sheets and OpenAI; credentials are required to connect your accounts.

Status filtering ensures only content marked as ‚ÄúStart‚Äù is processed ‚Äî making it safe to use in multi-user workflows.

‚öôÔ∏è How It Works

Trigger the workflow manually (can be changed to schedule/cron or webhook).

Reads from a Google Sheet with guest post planning data.

Merges the writing prompt, brand guidelines, and posting rules.

Sends the merged data to OpenAI (via the AI Agent node) to generate a guest post in German.

Saves the result into another Google Sheet.

Updates the original row's status from ‚ÄúStart‚Äù to ‚ÄúFinished‚Äù to prevent duplicates.

‚ñ∂Ô∏è How to Use

You must connect your Google Sheets and OpenAI accounts.

Customize the AI prompt, tone, or language by editing the input structure.

You can modify the filter to run only on certain months or categories.

The Gmail node is optional and only used to notify when no action was taken.

üß∞ Requirements

OpenAI account (API key for GPT-4 or GPT-3.5)

Google account with access to the configured Sheets

Basic knowledge of how n8n expressions work (optional)

üõ†Ô∏è Customising This Workflow

This guest post writer workflow can easily be adapted to other use cases:

Write social media content from a spreadsheet

Generate product descriptions from catalog data

Automatically translate or rewrite articles in different tones/languages

Create personalized outreach emails using AI

üéÅ The workflow includes built-in explanations (sticky notes) to guide you through each part of the process.

nodes.name: Notify When No Action is Taken

parameters.message: Hey change the sheets Config status.
parameters.subject: Config not activated, workflow stoped

parameters.content:
## üß† Overview
This workflow automates the generation of guest post content using OpenAI, based on inputs from a Google Sheet. It is designed to streamline outreach content production.

- Input: Google Sheet with topics, month, and writing parameters
- Output: AI-generated article in German, saved back to a Google Sheet
- Includes: Status checks, notifications, merge logic, and content generation

## 1. Manual Trigger & Config
This part of the workflow starts manually and reads the configuration sheet containing all scheduled content rows.

Only rows with STATUS = "Start" are processed.

## 2. Merge Guest Post Data
This node merges:
- Guest post topic input
- Writing rules
- Portfolio requirements
...into a single object to be passed to the OpenAI Agent.

## 3. Generate Content with AI
The AI Agent uses the merged input to generate a guest post in German.

Model: OpenAI GPT-4 (configurable)
Memory: Optional

## 4. Save Results
- Append generated content to the Outreach Sheet
- Mark the original row in Config sheet as "Finished"

## Optional: Email Notification
If the status is not "Start", the workflow sends a Gmail notification to let you know that no action was taken.

main.node: Notify When No Action is Taken

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
